lenders.name: richard
lenders.loan_because: this is a great idea to help people help themselves
lenders.occupational_info: i am a doctor and treat people who have chronic pain

lenders.name: jeffrey
lenders.loan_because: It just feels right.

lenders.name: Rodney & Tina
lenders.loan_because: We loan b/c we are blessed and have an attitude of gratitude.  So little from us, so much for them.

lenders.name: Michael
lenders.loan_because: We are all in this together.
lenders.occupational_info: I design office buildings, houses and stores here in Miami, Florida USA.

lenders.name: Katelin
lenders.loan_because: I'm hoping to 'be the change'.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a family medicine resident.

lenders.name: Jerome
lenders.loan_because: I believe in the human spirit and the free enterprise system
lenders.occupational_info: I retired from a large US insurance company.

lenders.name: Mike H.
lenders.loan_because: It makes a better me.I think the best thing for all people is self help honest work and education.If the situitation were reversed I think these people would lend to me. All my loans are made in a non religious,non political,and non profit way.

lenders.name: Daryl & Kathy
lenders.loan_because: it's the right thing to do.

lenders.name: Mimi
lenders.loan_because: I am able to do so and I hope I can make a difference in people's lives.
lenders.occupational_info: My heart is in bird photography.  I am a tax accountant in real life, however.  It's the accounting that pays for the bird photography.  Most times, you have to pay the bills first and follow your passion after that.  That's me.

lenders.name: Joanne
lenders.loan_because: I believe that microfinance empowers entrepreneurs in developing countries (as well as developed ones)
lenders.occupational_info: Having spent the past couple of years working in finance, I am excited to volunteer as a Kiva Fellow (KF12) and see how microfinance works first-hand.

lenders.name: Jacob Fyda
lenders.loan_because:
Most children who don't attend school cannot afford the uniform required by schools or their parents need them to work around the family farm/business.
Most deaths are from preventable diseases. 
Most impoverished farmers cannot support their family because there are not sufficient roads to transport goods.
One solution to the underlying problems is  economic development. Micro-financing loans are a small part of a conscious effort to promote small business and help eradicate poverty.
lenders.occupational_info: So many people have potential life, yet, that potential is hardly ever let thrive. In this case, we're presented with numerous individuals who have that very same potential. It's potential business initiatives that can provide for a better future for those surrounding them.

lenders.name: debbie
lenders.loan_because: I have enough to eat, a clean warm place to sleep, and so do my children.  I have been blessed.  I want the same for everyone, everywhere, and it is possible if we all give from our hearts.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in a hospital that takes care of people, even if they do not have much money.

lenders.name: Kathryn
lenders.loan_because: It's one of the best way to make a difference in the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach Macroeconomics at a University in Louisiana USA

lenders.name: Hodge
lenders.loan_because: It's a small but good way to help realize the ideal of "free minds and free markets."
lenders.occupational_info: My firm helps organizations get the right people in the right jobs and helps people reach their potential on the job.

lenders.name: Dan
lenders.loan_because: It helps me sleep a little bit better at night.
lenders.occupational_info: It's like every day is Friday.

lenders.name: Connie
lenders.loan_because: I like empowering people to be self-sufficient.
lenders.occupational_info:
I run a preschool for children ages 3-5 in a Jewish Community Center.

I am also an expecting Mother.

lenders.name: Gary
lenders.loan_because: This is an excellent program - I especially like that it is not a give away program. It allows the lender to feel a sense of pride in ownership.
lenders.occupational_info: I own apartment rentals.

lenders.name: Ann
lenders.loan_because: I'm planning to loan in honour and memory of my grandfather, James McKelvie, who sits beside me in this last photo we took together. He never judged anyone no matter what their circumstances and offered his help to whoever needed it. When he worked as a railway station master, he was very kind to the homeless who made the station their refuge. At the end of each day, despite being told not to, he would find a way to leave sandwiches from the diner out for them. I'm inspired by his warmth and generosity and want to carry the best of him forward in my own life.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in marketing and public relations, and I help companies build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders through effective communications practices.

lenders.name: Annamarie
lenders.loan_because: Thanks to the Kiva organization,my small contributions can help make a difference to others all over the world. I believe in Kiva's philosophy and am very pleased to be able to do my part.
lenders.occupational_info: I am currently retired but I taught primary age children in public school. I  also worked as school library/media specialist. Since my retirement I have volunteered for several non-profit organizations and I take an interest in my community.

lenders.name: coyote
lenders.loan_because: it is quite simply the right thing to do.  I owe my brothers and sisters at least this much.
lenders.occupational_info: I reveal the past to the present in hopes of altering the future.

lenders.name: Carol
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people
lenders.occupational_info: I write romance novels.

lenders.name: Kent & Patty
lenders.loan_because: As small business people ourselves, we understand that entrepreneurs may need money to finance a start-up or to grow their businesses, and that it can be difficult to borrow money from a bank.
lenders.occupational_info: Kent publishes nonfiction books about Alaska. Patty operates a nursery school for children ages 3-5.

lenders.name: Karen
lenders.loan_because: I think it is our responsibilty to help others less fortunate than ourselves. Despite our ethnic, cultural, and socio-economic differences, I think all people want to live in a safe world and make it a better place.
lenders.occupational_info:
I am an educational curriculum writer and editor for several publishing companies. I enjoy using the power of words to enrich children's lives.
2013: I have returned to teaching and love helping children realize their unique gifts.

lenders.name: Kaj
lenders.loan_because: Because it's nice and to help people.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm 10 years old, so mostly I'm a student (in Japan). I like drawing comics and playing basketball.

lenders.name: Jenny
lenders.loan_because: I want to share what I have been given with other people who have amazing dreams.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with at-risk youth to help them reach their full potential and maximum joy.

lenders.name: Rrain
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.name: DENISE
lenders.loan_because: It is important for me that my money is going to the people and causes I intend and not being lost in some big box charity.

lenders.name: Dylan
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.name: Lia
lenders.loan_because: I think this is a very good way to give people a better chance in life, and help them build up a future for themselves and their children.
lenders.occupational_info: we do all sorts of agicultural work, ploughing, drilling, harvesting grain, potatoes, carrots, and like farmers all over he world we go along with the seasons and we are dependant on the weather.

lenders.name: Sunder Kennady
lenders.loan_because: I wanted to do the best to overcome poverty.
lenders.occupational_info: I handle passenger in the international airport.

lenders.name: Guillermo
lenders.loan_because: Too often we underestimate the power of a touch, a smile, a kind word, a listening ear, an honest compliment, or the smallest act of caring, all of which have the potential to turn a life around.

lenders.name: Hugh Dow
lenders.loan_because: Because I like to see businesses working and I admire entrepreneurship.
lenders.occupational_info: I run a business which helps office workers get more done with less effort.

lenders.name: Jaynieeee
lenders.loan_because: A little goes a long way

lenders.name: Wee Cheng
lenders.loan_because: I believe in a more equalitarian world where everyone is given the same opportunities to work hard and improve their lives.  Whilst some of us live in societies where developed capital and credit markets can assist the man-on-the-street to realise his dreams, there are many who simply do not have access to such opportunities.  Kiva provides a platform to bridge this gap, and perhaps we can all contribute to this aim.
lenders.occupational_info: I measure and count beans planted and sold in one country, and then informed investors who live in another country about the findings, in the hope that more people round the world will invest in planting more beans in the first country.

lenders.name: daniel
lenders.loan_because: when people from around the world come together it has a big inpack

lenders.name: Jennifer
lenders.occupational_info: I schedule, supervise and inspect the construction of new homes in Santa Fe, New Mexico, USA.

lenders.name: Dante & Sebastien
lenders.loan_because: everyone has the right to create their own financial future and because we are fortunate enough to be able to give back.

lenders.name: Shimi
lenders.loan_because: each $25 is well spent and put to good use!

lenders.name: Elizabeth
lenders.loan_because: It's the right thing to do, and the best way to get money to deserving folks in need.
lenders.occupational_info: I serve as a contact for the public and the media for a state transportation program.

lenders.name: Alexander
lenders.loan_because: I think that helping others will help counteract some of the poverty and suffering that my present government is causing around the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I create advertising to help my clients sell products to consumers. In my spare time I create art sculptures out of discarded materials. I like to help others help themselves.

lenders.name: Leananeb
lenders.loan_because: We think it is not fair for the developing countries that people do not get the help they need to live in dignity. The so-called first world has a moral debt to this people.
lenders.occupational_info: I am Laura and I am a linguist, I teach foreign languages, translate books and documents, work as an interpreter, etc. Santi is an IT engineer, he works with computers and software for a Spanish housing firm.

lenders.name: Carol
lenders.loan_because: as a family we want to help others.
lenders.occupational_info: We are a family who had decided that it is important to be more involved in our own children's education.  As parents, we want to instill a sense of helping others in our children.

lenders.name: Bonnie
lenders.occupation: Mother of a Peace Corps Volunteer

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: this is a way that I can join my modest resources with that of others and make a tangible difference to a very real person.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in a very large hospital and help take care of people who need heart surgery or other procedures related to their heart.

lenders.name: Kathy
lenders.loan_because: It makes me feel better about myself and helps others - that's a powerful combination!
lenders.occupational_info: I travel to places like the Philippines and India to train people to handle business calls from North Americans.

lenders.name: Ethan
lenders.loan_because: Now, I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm learning to design and build buildings that will hopefully make the world a better place.

lenders.name: Alison
lenders.loan_because: it's so easy to help someone who really needs it. When you think about how just a small amount of money can literally turn someone's life around, I can't imagine *not* wanting to do it!

lenders.name: Melissa
lenders.loan_because: it's a great way to help people help themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I run a preK-12th grade public school district in a rural area.

lenders.name: Steve, Kindie, and Annie
lenders.loan_because: We believe that micro-financing and direct person-to-person links have the potential to change the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I design computer software and consult with businesses and government agencies.

lenders.name: Ian, Ellen and Heather
lenders.loan_because: we are fortunate enough to be able to.
lenders.occupational_info: Ian works for a chain of furniture stores; Ellen works in a school library; and Heather is a high school student.

lenders.name: stephen Landau
lenders.loan_because: I like to see people have a chance to improve their lives.

lenders.name: Maryann
lenders.loan_because: I've long wished for one-to-one charitable giving opportunities. This is a personalized and sustainable way to improve living conditions for one good soul at a time.
lenders.occupational_info: I am the editor of a magazine published by an organization that develops quality standards.

lenders.name: St. Paul
lenders.loan_because: My confirmation class is committed to supporting people in need. We also take seriously the Millenium Development Goals, #1, The eradication of Extreme Poverty, #3, Gender equalization, and #5, Maternal health. Jesus tells us to feed the hungry, tend the sick, and give to those in need. This is what we want to do.

lenders.name: Diane
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.name: Rhonda
lenders.loan_because: I can and I care.  It's such a small amount to me, but like thousands to them.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in the auto industry- General Motors.

lenders.name: Sabrina
lenders.loan_because: As a woman and entrepreneur, I understand the difficulties that woman face in the bussiness world and would like to help encourage more woman to enter it.

lenders.name: debra
lenders.loan_because: to give others a helping hand with independance.

lenders.name: Jacqueline
lenders.loan_because: I believe in helping those who are trying to help themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: A very fortunate woman, who presently enjoys a comfortable life on a farm, which I attained through hard work, perseverance, and a bit of luck.   I would like to help others do the same, hence my participation in KIVA  which I consider a great way of helping others in the 'bit of luck' department!

lenders.name: Giovanni
lenders.loan_because: I think that if lucky people help and support other people, we will stay in a better world!

lenders.name: Shelly
lenders.loan_because: I strongly support building better lives and communities through sound economic foundations, especially for women!
lenders.occupational_info: I am a Certified Public Accountant working on income taxes, financial statements, investments, and financial advice.

lenders.name: Greer
lenders.loan_because: I can change someone's life for the better

lenders.name: Stuart
lenders.loan_because: As a Christian, I believe I have a responsibility to help the less fortunate.  Helping them help themselves...
lenders.occupational_info: I manage a software development company.  We develop software for banks, financial firms, large retailers, insurance companies, etc.

lenders.name: Melissa
lenders.loan_because: I'm passionately interested in establishing connections across the globe, and in helping people one-to-one instead of through big and inefficient organizations.
lenders.occupational_info: I sing beautiful music.  It is hard work, but it is so rewarding.  I am lucky to have a job that is so thrilling.

lenders.name: Thomas
lenders.loan_because: It is a means to help others who are working to help themselves, their families and communities. I have been fortunate in my life and this is my small attempt to "pay it forward".

lenders.name: Sharon
lenders.loan_because: it's a wonderful way to help people help themselves.

lenders.name: Cressant
lenders.loan_because: I like to be able to help people.

lenders.name: Timothy Bell
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a difference.

lenders.name: Chris
lenders.whereabouts: Little Weighton East Riding of Yorkshire

lenders.name: BroderWriter
lenders.loan_because: as Susan Werner says in her song "Help Somebody" on the Album, The Gospel Truth, "When you've got enough to give away, [that's] the only way to live." And "I got a roof over my head; what do I do?" The call and response ends with Werner saying, "I go out and help somebody get a roof over their head, too."
lenders.occupational_info: Nonfiction writer, food writer, foodie, poet, mother of an eight-year-old, and volunteer,

lenders.name: Della
lenders.loan_because: I own a small business and I know how important a loan can be. I also loan because it's important to help, that's what it's all about, helping...

lenders.name: stephen
lenders.loan_because: i can and i care
lenders.occupational_info: i own a small grocery store in chicago. we sell organic and natural foods.

lenders.name: Erik
lenders.loan_because: I like the idea of helping people help themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I search for market needs and develop products that I can sell to hungry markets, preferrably over the Internet

lenders.name: Rob
lenders.loan_because: I read the Kristof article about Kiva in the New York Times and thought it sounded neat-- and it really is!

lenders.name: Karin
lenders.loan_because: it is my small way of saving the world.
lenders.occupational_info: Energy Efficiency Consultant

lenders.name: Rene
lenders.occupational_info: cancer research

lenders.name: Kim
lenders.occupation: Stay at home Mom to 3 boys and community volunteer
lenders.loan_because: I know that the very best way to "feel good" is to help others. Giving brings rewards like nothing else I have ever experienced. Kiva has made it possible to feel as if I am helping those about whom I would otherwise never even be able to know, never mind reach in some small way.
lenders.occupational_info: I love being a stay at home Mom to my three boys, ages 11, 9 and 20 months. And I love being out in the community and at my children's school doing a wide variety of wolunteer work.

lenders.name: Carol
lenders.loan_because: Getting beyond the sightseeing and making connections with local people  enhances any travel experience. Lending to local entrepreneurs and learning something about their business seems to be a good way for travelers to connect and give something back to the communities they visit. I hope to meet a few of the people in Sliven while I'm in Bulgaria next month.

lenders.name: The Conn Family
lenders.loan_because: We are a Roman Catholic family who believes in social justice in action. We hear lots of talk about securing the borders in this country to prevent "illegal aliens" from coming in. We feel that the best way to do that is to help persons in Mexico provide for themselves and their families so they won't need to leave their families behind seeking employment in other lands. We feel that people in the richest country in the world should take action to help people in poorer countries.
lenders.occupational_info: Our husband/father works at a local university.  Our wife/mother is a full-time mother caring for our home and children.

lenders.name: George
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a teacher at a Los Angeles (California, USA) public high school and cover mainly technical fields: programming (C++, JAVA), digital imaging, and game design.

lenders.name: Nickolas
lenders.loan_because: We have so much in the United States that we take for granted.  When I step back and look, I see that the rest of the world is much different.  Kiva is one of the many small things we can do to help.

lenders.name: Jared
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people improve their lives in a way that's dignified and self sustaining.
lenders.occupational_info: Mediocre middle aged endurance athlete, traveler, history fan and (sometimes true) story teller.  I help solve performance problems in enterprise scale networks, for a living and for fun.

lenders.name: Louis and Lorna
lenders.loan_because: we like the idea of helping out at grassroot level and think that, through kiva, impact is delivered to where it is most needed quickest.
lenders.occupational_info: your average jane and joe.

lenders.name: Sarah
lenders.loan_because: You reap what you sow
lenders.occupational_info: I support the process of moving clothing around the world

lenders.name: jennifer & Jason
lenders.loan_because: To improve population health we need to reduce poverty, poverty is poison.

lenders.name: Richard & Kathleen
lenders.loan_because: Encouraging entrepreneurship around the world to ensure a better life for those less fortunate.
lenders.occupational_info: Real Estate Investments

lenders.name: Carol & David Grant
lenders.loan_because: Microcredit has been proven to be a far more effective way to deal with the problems of third world poverty than government handouts.
lenders.occupational_info: I help small business owners and entrepreneurs to protect their assets and save on taxes.  I hope that some of them will  invest some of those savings through organizations like Kiva.

lenders.name: Nancy
lenders.loan_because: I feel blessed for what I have and want to try and help others fulfill their dreams

lenders.name: Mel
lenders.loan_because: I loan because it is the right thing to do. So many people look at the problems in the World which are often overwhelming and say what can I do. It is heart warming to know that the great and small can help to change another life for the better. Every one that can should help. There but for the grace of God go I.

lenders.name: Carol
lenders.loan_because: I want to help make life better for others
lenders.occupational_info: I work in an office, dealing with collecting money from others and paying company obligations

lenders.name: Gary
lenders.loan_because: This extension of the mini-loan concept is a great idea. Good luck to all.

lenders.name: Ram
lenders.loan_because: To help others.

lenders.name: Team Adams
lenders.loan_because: The Lord our God says "Love your neighbor as yourself."

lenders.name: 4bubz
lenders.loan_because: I've traveled to economically disadvantaged countries and I have consistently been impressed by the will it must take to survive the hardships. The working poor in all countries are especially vulnerable, and I know that what is not much money to me will make an enormous difference when loaned in this manner.

lenders.name: Sandra
lenders.loan_because: It's the Christian thing to do.
lenders.occupational_info: I assist individuals with becoming self-sufficient. I help individuals who are unemployed, underemployed find work

lenders.name: dave & bev
lenders.loan_because: we all need a helping hand at one time or another.

lenders.name: Susan
lenders.loan_because: My heart told me to. Also, it's a very practical thing: if I can help someone with a leg up, maybe they can do the same one day. It rolls uphill.
lenders.occupational_info: We live on a small farm in Oregon where we raise Jacob sheep, keep a flock of hens, and some hives of bees. And I play ukulele.

lenders.name: Elaine
lenders.loan_because: I just had to after I read about this organization.  I hope I'm helping people make a permanent difference in their lives.

lenders.name: Tom
lenders.loan_because: Kiva makes it possible.
lenders.occupational_info: I am retired. I used to be an antique dealer. I write fiction.

lenders.name: Patricia
lenders.loan_because: I can and because it feels nice to share my good fortune.

lenders.name: Tom
lenders.loan_because: I admire people who work hard to improve their lives, and love the idea of offering them some help.
lenders.occupational_info: I was a writer of marketing materials for Visa, the credit and debit card company.

lenders.name: Daniel
lenders.loan_because: I lend a hand because I can. It makes me feel good.
lenders.occupational_info: American Capitalist extrodonaire..

lenders.name: Christopher
lenders.loan_because: i am inspired by people making their lives better.
lenders.occupational_info: planning the installation of small (4-120 phones) telephone systems

lenders.name: Helen
lenders.loan_because: I want to support entrepreneurs.
lenders.occupational_info: I organize and plan things.

lenders.name: Jean
lenders.loan_because: I've been fortunate in life and it is time to give back.
lenders.occupational_info: I run an NGO that advocates for social and economic justice.

lenders.name: The Winters
lenders.loan_because: It takes so little to make someone else's life much better.

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: I believe in helping others to help themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I search for solutions to complicated problems.

lenders.name: Bryan
lenders.loan_because: God had shown me too much grace that not listening to Him when Christ said to love my neighbor as myself would be selfish. If I am fortunate enough to be able to go out and buy a t-shirt or a CD when I just want one, then shouldn't I be able to sacrifice those things to help others do what they need to do to make their lives more full.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a music student at Florida State University. I'm also an amatuer musician and I do ministry work with teenagers.

lenders.name: Adrian
lenders.loan_because: I believe in the microloan system.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people whose homes have been destroyed by catastrophe.

lenders.name: Amanda
lenders.loan_because: I am where I am because people have helped me.
lenders.occupational_info: Sales for an energy company

lenders.name: Gloria
lenders.loan_because: If you cast your bread cast on the waters, it comes back to you. But, even if you should never see the deed again, you will have made the world a better place.
lenders.occupational_info: Each day I continue to try to make a difference...a life well lived is measured by the depth of our humanity.

lenders.name: Kristen and Marnix
lenders.loan_because: It feels good to help people -- especially in a way that celebrates initiative and dignity.

lenders.name: Justin
lenders.occupational_info: Georgetown Law/Georgetown Public Policy Institute Class of 2011

lenders.name: Stephanie
lenders.loan_because: it is important to take a chance on people and show them you think they can make it!

lenders.name: Richard C.
lenders.occupational_info:
I was an Avocado and Citrus farmer on irrigated land in Southern California.

That land, on which we worked so hard, is now planted in houses and all the Avocado trees are gone.

lenders.name: Jose
lenders.loan_because: I want to do something good in life....I'm not rich, but I do know that I've been dealt a better hand in life than most of the people requesting loans and feel that I need to balance the universe a little bit
lenders.occupational_info: I work for in Logistics supplying materials to build telephone related equipment or supplies....I basically keep watch over inventory and forecast upcoming usages for certain materials

lenders.name: Mattie
lenders.loan_because: I am fortunate to have a decent standard of living and want to help others who desire the same and are willing to take a risk.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a retired teacher.  I plan to travel more and went to Senegal in March 2013 to visit a child I sponsor. It was truly a memorable experience.

lenders.name: Etienne
lenders.loan_because: I just want to help.

lenders.name: Grant
lenders.loan_because:
I was lucky to be born into a particular family, country, society, and time-period where hard work can earn a comfortable living.

I loan to help those who aren't quite as lucky.

lenders.name: Vigfus
lenders.occupation: Musichian and I work at a printers
lenders.loan_because: The industrial nations have used and abused the third world long enough. Time for change.
lenders.occupational_info: I get printed items to my end of the factory where I do the finishing, pack it up and ship it out.

lenders.name: chrislaurelsierrakayla
lenders.loan_because: c'mon people, we can do this!

lenders.name: Arianne
lenders.loan_because: The KIVA organisation offers me a unique, positive and very easy way to support others.

lenders.name: Andrew
lenders.whereabouts: US Air Force Europe HQ Ramstein Air Base
lenders.loan_because: after teaching physics and computer literacy in Jinja, Uganda, the need to financially leverage SME's became more apparent.  This is one way I can get more involved and educated.  I hope to find an NGO in a developing area to work with Summer 09 before starting an MBA program Fall 09.
lenders.occupational_info: I lead airmen and mentor cross-disciplinary teams in the intelligence field to support strategic planning for the USAF Europe headquarters.

lenders.name: Curtis
lenders.loan_because: I initially read about this in the New York Times, and I thought it was an awesome idea.  I also read "Blue Like Jazz" by Don Miller, and was inspired to start tithing.  I'm not a member of any church, so my tithing goes almost entirely to Kiva entrepreneurs!  Once my loans are repaid, I donate the money back to Kiva for the good work they do.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a student at the University of Oregon.  I study politics, and am a very staunch supporter of Barack Obama!

lenders.name: girish
lenders.loan_because:
I want to help maximum people become Conscious and successful Entrepreneurs effortlessly.

I understand someone who is at such poverty levels has to be lifted up before they can liberate their true potential as a human.

I admire, appreciate these fellow beings who are doing something on their own. Very few of highly educated people have the courage to become an entrepreneur and keep struggling in a job.
lenders.occupational_info:
I am currently connecting with others to start making my vision a reality.

I want to help make maximum people Conscious - loving, realising our ONEness and liberate their entrepreneurial spirit (which i believe everyone has) for the freedom, progress & abundance of self & society.

Please check my profile (website) for further details about me.

lenders.name: Stephen
lenders.loan_because: Microcredit via Kiva is a potentially massive strategy than could actually better the condition of billions. Reliance on charitable and philanthropic enterprises alone has not achieved this. Grass roots enablement can.
lenders.occupational_info: During the 1960s I founded Renewal Magazine and wrote extensively on civil rights . church renewal and international development. I later worked for UNICEF and edited UNDP's CHOICES -- sadly defunct now. I want to change the world with words. Individuals can do it on the Web. Motivated individuals rule. Together with proper values, individuals can prevail over principalities and powers.

lenders.name: Christoph
lenders.loan_because: microcredits are sustainable, fair and efficient

lenders.name: Barack Oblogger
lenders.loan_because: I wish to support people in achieving their dreams and goals.
lenders.occupational_info: We  support President Barack Obama for re-election and wish to spread a message of hope and self-determination across the globe. "Yes We Can!"

lenders.name: Joshua
lenders.loan_because: I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach Englsih at a university in Tokyo, Japan.

lenders.name: Marco Bombardi
lenders.loan_because: I loan because I believe in people who take ethical action to better their lives.

lenders.name: Thomas
lenders.loan_because: Life is too short.
lenders.occupational_info: We make and install drapery, shades and blinds.

lenders.name: Daniel
lenders.loan_because: there was alway someone there for me, and this is a great idea to help others.

lenders.name: STEPHANIE
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people in the world and particulary women because I thing women are the future as their children education
lenders.occupational_info: i take care of children and i try to treat them. my job is fascinating

lenders.name: Willa
lenders.loan_because: I am learning about helping people  who are not as lucky as we are.
lenders.occupational_info: My mom helps people who have been arrested and are in jail.

lenders.name: Paul
lenders.loan_because:
The surest way to build peace and prosperity in this world is to encourage individual enterprise, ownership, and autonomy; in short, we need capitalism. Hand outs typically only create dependency and de facto slavery. Loans respect and foster wealth creation, and as "hand ups" that respect and preserve the autonomy of the enterprising individual who receives them, they foster freedom.

"Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime." -- Chinese proverb
lenders.occupational_info: I am a small business owner, an investor in various equity and debt markets, I trade currencies, and I am a licensed pest management professional. I also occasionally teach philosophy courses at the community college/university level.

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: I can help others.
lenders.occupational_info: I design computers and computer software.

lenders.name: Dale C.
lenders.loan_because: We can't depend on our leaders to find our way out of the myriad of problems this world faces. After all, they're the ones that got us here. We can only save the world by organizing at the personal level, all together, or at least as many of us together as truly believe in the ideals of liberty and justice for all.
lenders.occupational_info: I manage a library in an engineering company, and assist my engineers in inventing new technologies which I hope will help the world find solutions to its many problems.

lenders.name: Michael
lenders.loan_because: This is a way to connect with and help others.   It is also good for me in many, many ways.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a retired teacher.  Currently, I volunteer with the Juvenile Courts in our county.

lenders.name: Gary
lenders.loan_because: I am new to Kiva, I received a gift certificate from my wife. I then checked out the web site and organization. I had no idea any thing like this existed. I plan to add more to my account and hope to make additional loans.
lenders.occupational_info:
I work for a small utility company that provides natural gas and electricity to about 40,000 customers. My department consists of a small group of men and we do electric line construction and maintenance.

I live in the northeastern part of the U.S., where weather can make my job quite interesting. There are times we will get storms that knock out the power and we will work around the clock for days, with little breaks, to restore power.

lenders.name: David M.
lenders.loan_because: By combining a little seed capital with faith and opportunity the world becomes more friendly and closer to purpose.
lenders.occupational_info: I own a collection agency based out of Atlanta Georgia. We help firms collect delinquent accounts in the medical, consumer and commercial markets.

lenders.name: Lynelle
lenders.loan_because: A small action on my part can make a big difference for someone else.  I like the direct connection that Kiva and its partners provide.
lenders.occupational_info: I help protect people from the harmful effects of pollution.

lenders.name: Gertrude
lenders.loan_because: it is a way to repay those who helped me.
lenders.occupational_info: I create and manage team processes so that large groups of people doing different jobs can work together to build new software and hardware support systems for our company, which delivers time-sensitive packages to over 220 countries and territories worldwide.

lenders.name: Ray
lenders.loan_because: I believe in market discipline and in integrating the world by providing open access to credit, markets, and knowledge. Micro-finance seems to be a powerful way to boost development, and this is the first approach I have seen that allows small lenders to become involved.

lenders.name: Ryan and Sebastian
lenders.loan_because: I love this idea and wish that I had though of it while volunteering in Ecuador.
lenders.occupational_info: I work to promote renewable energy and energy efficiency programs and policies

lenders.name: Muhammad Imran
lenders.loan_because: I want to make GSM Mobile Franchise (Telecommunication). I hav done Master in Information Technology. I need 65000 us$
lenders.occupational_info: This is related to Telecommunication, and its Mobile Franchise

lenders.name: Jos
lenders.occupational_info: providing music to the theatre

lenders.name: richard
lenders.loan_because: i care
lenders.occupational_info: even though i am on disabilaty i am rich compared to these people

lenders.name: Cindy
lenders.loan_because: we are a global community and I believe an individual can make a difference.
lenders.occupational_info: I sell supplies for use in restaurants - like frying pans, spatulas, containers.  My customers are global.

lenders.name: Brent
lenders.loan_because: We need more Big Heart globally!
lenders.occupational_info: embrace more, understand more.

lenders.name: KivaKids
lenders.loan_because: Helping people live better makes us better off too.
lenders.occupational_info: We are three sisters who are still in school in Pennsylvania.

lenders.name: Martha
lenders.loan_because: I struggled for years trying to support my family and I know how rough it can be.  I now have more than I need and would like to help those who want to help themselves.

lenders.name: Christina
lenders.loan_because: It's an affordable way for someone like me with a small income to make an impact.

lenders.name: Oz
lenders.loan_because: a small helping hand can make a large difference.

lenders.name: Susan
lenders.occupation: Non-Profit Org. Exec. & Mother to 4 great people
lenders.loan_because: Because I can.
lenders.occupational_info: Non profit Insurance (believe it or not)

lenders.name: Maurice
lenders.loan_because: this is a good constructive way to help

lenders.name: Tom
lenders.loan_because: I have been given much and loaned to often.
lenders.occupational_info: I use computers to do public health work for the US government.

lenders.name: Kalin
lenders.loan_because: I don't live to work.  I don't work to live.  I live and work to share.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in the Development department at a non-profit organization.  My work revolves around raising funding. We work with abused and neglect children ages 0-5 years old.

lenders.name: Anabel
lenders.loan_because: everybody in this wealthy, privileged country is morally obligated to help, in whatever ways they can.
lenders.occupational_info: wife, mother, daughter, sister, artist, gardener, cook, cleaner, manager - probably in that order...

lenders.name: Ana
lenders.loan_because: I belive I should do it
lenders.occupational_info: I hope I am like a friend who gives a help in an inportant moment making a small amount of money brings hope and courage to never give up believing life is worth living

lenders.name: Ken
lenders.loan_because: I want to assist others achieve prosperity in their own countries.

lenders.name: Castro-Koll Family
lenders.loan_because: I see the future prosperity of the world when supporting those who are impoverished.  It gives them a chance to live enthusiastically and positively influence their communities, which will in turn postively influence mine.

lenders.name: Jeff & Brigitte
lenders.loan_because: We can.
lenders.occupational_info: Brigitte teaches French language & culture, Jeff teaches French language, early modern French literature & European Studies

lenders.name: Bill
lenders.loan_because: I like to help make good things happen.
lenders.occupational_info: I design computer systems for libraries.

lenders.name: Ryn
lenders.loan_because: my mom got me started on it.

lenders.name: Connie
lenders.loan_because: Although there are problems here in the United States, I think that there are other places in the world who deserve our attention. I like the KIVA concept because every little bit helps!
lenders.occupational_info: I am studying so that I may be a scholar in the area of comparative, or international, criminology: The study of crime across countries and how criminal behavior differs between countries.

lenders.name: Yvonne
lenders.loan_because: I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I support retail buyers and planners with the systems and reports they use to make buying and planning decisions.

lenders.name: khaled
lenders.loan_because: As a Muslim and as a person, it is my obligation to help those in need. Microfinancing is the perfect outlet for this.
lenders.occupational_info: I manange the development of web-based applications for a large oil company.

lenders.name: Joe
lenders.loan_because: this seems to be the best way any individual can have immediate impact to help others lift themselves up
lenders.occupational_info: I help make computers do something for our business that is needed.

lenders.name: Paul
lenders.loan_because: I think this is a wonderful way to help.

lenders.name: Treesje
lenders.loan_because: trade is universal and brings people together. Shops and marketstalls have social-economic importance.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm working in child protection schemes with the governementand am specialised  in child developmentdisorders

lenders.name: Rana
lenders.loan_because: I am
lenders.occupational_info: I fix things

lenders.name: Sue and Stuart
lenders.loan_because: Trade is a way to peace and equality

lenders.name: Ollen
lenders.loan_because: I want to help others who are striving to help themselves, their families and their communities.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a computer chip maker where I am responsible for high-purity metal deposition processes.

lenders.name: Ingrid and Michel
lenders.loan_because: We are very lucky to live in Holland and enjoy a healthy and good life. We love helping others.

lenders.name: Marjorie
lenders.loan_because: That's what brothers and sisters do -- give each other a boost once in a while.
lenders.occupational_info: I help solve business problems with computer software solutions.

lenders.name: Craig and Cindy
lenders.loan_because: We loan just because.
lenders.occupational_info: Craig is a student pursuing a Doctorate in Policy Studies hoping to work for organizations like KIVA.  Cindy is an engineer in the production of airplanes.

lenders.name: Mark
lenders.loan_because:
I believe this is a much better idea than just giving a donation or handout.  In my experience as a doctor, the patients that take a more active role in their care generally are healthier, happier, and have a much better quality of life.  The same principal applies here.  The obligation to pay back what you have borrowed helps a person develop responsibility and become independent.

I also love that many of the businesses on Kiva's site are owned by women.  I hope that this will help give women in other countries the same opportunities that are possible in the United States.
lenders.occupational_info: A doctor!! What else to say.

lenders.name: Chris
lenders.loan_because: I am fortunate to have a job and I was previously a business owner. I understand first hand how difficult it can be to obtain funds from the traditional banking system.I want to help someone who is interested in helping themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with engineers and designers to develop software applications that streamline the engineering, design and manufacturing process for new products and  ideas.

lenders.name: Maurice
lenders.loan_because: We all need to help where we can.
lenders.occupational_info: I manage a small biotechnology company in the US.

lenders.name: Teresa
lenders.loan_because: Microlending seems like the most direct way to help others build a better life for themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I work to clean up environmental pollution in rivers and harbors.

lenders.name: Vincent
lenders.loan_because: Making any positive difference, even if it's tiny, will result in a better future for all.

lenders.name: Patricia
lenders.loan_because: I want to make the world a little better day to day.
lenders.occupational_info: I do server/desktop computer support for a steelmaking company.

lenders.name: Wendy
lenders.loan_because: I believe in helping  people help themselves. I have "taken" much from countries I have traveled in and this is a way to give back.

lenders.name: Dave
lenders.loan_because: A little help is better than a lot of pity - especially when helping those who try their best to help themselves. Everyone should have at least the CHANCE to succeed in life.

lenders.name: Sharon
lenders.occupation: I work at Honda as a writer

lenders.name: Andrew
lenders.loan_because: What a great way to have an impact in this world. A great form of charity because the money you supply keeps giving and giving! That's a incredible concept that works.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in sales for my main job with a starting hobby in urban agriculture.

lenders.name: Campbell and Catie
lenders.loan_because: It is important to share with others in our good fortune.
lenders.occupational_info: We are responsible to learn and go to school.  Learning to share with others is our most important lesson.

lenders.name: richard
lenders.loan_because: For what shall it profit a man, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul?
lenders.occupational_info: I design industrial electrical controls.

lenders.name: Cheryl
lenders.loan_because: I can. And if you can, you should too.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for the citizens of Houston.

lenders.name: Erin
lenders.loan_because: I can

lenders.name: Jane & Andrew
lenders.occupational_info: Jane's working on her MFA in painting and Andrew's studying towards a doctorate in primatology, both in New Orleans.

lenders.name: Chanquest
lenders.loan_because: One person can make a difference.

lenders.name: Veronica Hoffman
lenders.loan_because: I can :)
lenders.occupational_info: I operate a small correctional facility where I teach men the virtues of treating women with the respect and adoration they deserve.

lenders.name: Danton
lenders.loan_because: I have been blessed with health and enough money to be happy, though I'm certainly not wealthy. I feel an obligation to help others when I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach English (writing and reading) to 7th and 8th grade students in a small, rural school.

lenders.name: Martin
lenders.loan_because: It is an opportunity to help people move from poverty and develop self confidence.

lenders.name: Vanessa
lenders.loan_because: I believe in empowering small business owners and like to cut out large bureaucracies--I love Kiva!
lenders.occupational_info: I teach young people how to manage their money.

lenders.name: Alice and Phil
lenders.loan_because: We can

lenders.name: Kathy
lenders.loan_because: it's something I can do to help families make better lives for themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I help owners of small businesses with their bookkeeping, so they can make their businesses more profitable.

lenders.name: Millicent
lenders.loan_because: Kiva makes it possible, with infinitely small effort and risk, to do more than simpy wait for large organizations or political bodies to fix a problem. Because it feels good, and is good, and makes tremendous sense. Because it rewards initiative and helps a few people know they are not entirely abandoned by the rest of the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I design internal websites and portals for large corporations that are intended to enable their people to be more effective in their work.

lenders.name: Lisa and Tony
lenders.loan_because: kiva takes an already great idea (microlending) and adds immediacy and simplicity to make it brilliant.
lenders.occupational_info: Lisa is a senior planning analyst with Hennepin County, who specializes in sustainable and equitable development.  Tony is a commercial photographer who specializes in editorial and portraiture of musicians and artists.

lenders.name: Andrew
lenders.loan_because: I am fortunate.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in financial administration for a university.

lenders.name: Laurel
lenders.loan_because: I am called by God to do so.

lenders.name: Meghan
lenders.loan_because: I have been looking for a meaningful way to help others- now that I've found kiva I can see that I am able to fulfill my goal while also forging bonds across the globe with a single click of the mouse. This is such a unique concept, and a completely rewarding way to connect with people around the world.

lenders.name: Donald
lenders.loan_because: I like the fact that I can control precisely where my money goes and that 100% of my donation goes there. $25 here and there means nothing to me in the long run, but to these folks, it's a large step toward financial security.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in the communications office of California Assembly Speaker Fabian Nunez and edit a Democratic blog, the California Majority Report.

lenders.name: daniel
lenders.loan_because: To share my good fortune.
lenders.occupational_info: I am working hard to keep myself and my family healthy and happy.

lenders.name: NGP
lenders.loan_because: I want to connect with humanity and show my support for those who are underserved
lenders.occupational_info: I am a student studying computer science and looking to develop computer systems to address the needs of all of humanity, not just those with the most wealth

lenders.name: Richard
lenders.loan_because: I want to help those in need to help themselves.

lenders.name: Brian and Joyce
lenders.loan_because: We have been so fortunate in our lives, and this is an opportunity to share with others, a chance to live their lives to their potential, and live out their dreams.

lenders.name: Miranda and Dola
lenders.loan_because: We have both lived in East Africa.  Dola is from Tanzania and Miranda lived there for three years.  We have witnessed the tremendous poverty throughout Africa as well as the strength and generosity of the people who live there.  We wanted to contribute something to help those in need of an extra boost.  We have all been in places where we've needed help from others, but the poor in Africa need it more than most.  We believe that microfinance can truly make a difference in the lives of people and thank Kiva for its excellent work to help us connect from so far away.  We also are mourning the passing of Miranda's 96-year old grandmother and gave our most recent loan in her memory.

lenders.name: Alisa
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a difference.

lenders.name: Terry & Michelle
lenders.loan_because: God's law is: Give and it shall be given; not just what you are "owed" but with the measure you use-if we give as we are blessed others are blessed and what goes around... comes around - Good Luck to everyone.
lenders.occupational_info: I (Michelle) work in accounting and on all 30 computers in our office including the network servers.  I like my job because no two days are the same.  Terry is retired from the USMC and he volunteers w/the county Sheriff Department two days a week helping in the courtroom and with the senior watch program.

lenders.name: Ryan
lenders.loan_because: I want to do what I can with the time that I have to help others.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a medical student but also work in the food service industry.

lenders.name: Nicholas
lenders.loan_because: it's fascinating that I can help someone financially but then not really spend any money in the end.
lenders.occupational_info: I study how to make computers easier for humans to use.

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: I have more than I need and think that it is important to share with others who may have fewer opportunities.
lenders.occupational_info: Prior to my retirement I worked in law enforcement.This job allows me to work with kids and their families to insure that they get an education. I used to teach high school.

lenders.name: Nicole
lenders.loan_because: it makes a positive difference.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a university student majoring in Speech-Language Pathology.

lenders.name: Steve
lenders.loan_because: The need is obvious. A good man, Bob Garnier died on 3-27-07 and the family said contribute to the cause of your choice. He was a creative man and he would have like the KIVA concept.
lenders.occupational_info: I retired as a Human Resources Manager. I am now a part-owner of a Market where we sell Antiques, Art and Collectibles.

lenders.name: carthy
lenders.loan_because: I think that it's better to put money in the hands of a person or a community to enable and empower them to change their lives rather than hoping a government or bank will do so.  Like all parents, I hope my children have brighter and better opportunities, so I also loan to help other parents help their children to a brighter future too.
lenders.occupational_info: I work on creating and supporting applications that run on computers that allow employees of my company to manage our products.  I work at a company that also supports microlending and communities of microentrepreneurs

lenders.name: Kristy
lenders.loan_because: I love helping people and hopefully I am doing my small part to make this world a better place to live. Good luck Teresia!

lenders.name: Fiona
lenders.loan_because: I like to support people who are working so hard, often in difficult circumstances and because Kiva makes it easy. It is also amazing (and rather guilt-inducing) to see how a small amount of money (for me) can go so far to making a difference in another part of the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I help financial companies find good people to work for them.

lenders.name: Laure and Nathan
lenders.loan_because: we are lucky to be where we are. We want to share what we have.

lenders.name: Milton
lenders.loan_because: the funds go directly to recipient
lenders.occupational_info: Retired

lenders.name: Teresa
lenders.loan_because: I am looking for a way to make a difference one small step at a time.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in rural Alaskan villages bringing economic development to low income areas.  The cost of success is high in Alaska so it feels good to be able to help individuals through small loans.

lenders.name: Erin & Derek
lenders.loan_because: It's nice to be able to help other people help themselves.  Maybe one day when they are successful they will lend to others in need.

lenders.name: Javier
lenders.loan_because: I have it and someone else needs it.

lenders.name: Rachelle
lenders.loan_because: every person has a story, and no circumstance or environment should keep it from being heard.

lenders.name: Dimitra
lenders.loan_because: A SMALL amount can make a BIG difference!

lenders.name: Rachel
lenders.loan_because: I have seen first hand how important microfinance is to development - not just the individuals but to the country. I want to help build a vibrant middle class in developing countries.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in international health - living mostly in foreign countries, working with host governments to improve health in their country - maternal and child health, AIDS, malaria

lenders.name: Jennifer
lenders.occupation: teacher of English as foreign language
lenders.loan_because: I love this world.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach business English to adult students in Belgrade, Serbia.  I also teach English as a foreign language to children ages 6-9.

lenders.name: Helmi
lenders.loan_because: I want to make poverty history.

lenders.name: PETER
lenders.loan_because: I'm able to.

lenders.name: vijayr
lenders.loan_because: Just feel like doing it
lenders.occupational_info: http://www.kiva.org/team/kiva_tools

lenders.name: Philippe
lenders.loan_because: I believe we're all connected in one or the other way... So if I can make a difference to people on the other side of the world, they can also make a difference  to others. You get what you give.
lenders.occupational_info: I am Chief Social Media Officer at the Van Marcke Group of Companies, responsible for the use of social media for internal and external communications & collaboration.

lenders.name: Sarah
lenders.loan_because: I think the world would be a healthier place if everyone  cared about the people in need and gave a helping hand. We have to take care of each other...or......the saddness will continue in the struggling areas of the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I photograph people. I am fasinated by humans and the environments they live in.

lenders.name: Liesbeth
lenders.loan_because: I believe in this way of contributing.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach people communication skills.

lenders.name: Pierre
lenders.loan_because: Because i can , because it pleases me, because Kiva makes it possible.

lenders.name: Hopkins family
lenders.loan_because: I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I write about new ideas that will make the world a better place.

lenders.name: Iain Lowe
lenders.loan_because: My father has been involved in the development of the third-world since I was a child. I grew up in Port-au-Prince, Haïti and Conakry, Guinea where he worked with groups such as CECI, CIDA, the World Bank and the United Nations. I like the ability to make affordable (for me) loans to specific individuals and to lend a helping hand where I can.
lenders.occupational_info: In an effort to increase companies' efficiency, I work with teams of people to build computer programs that replace repetitive and useless manual labour.

lenders.name: Jeff & Beth
lenders.loan_because: It's a small way to share the wealth we've been lucky to receive.
lenders.occupational_info: Helping others learn.

lenders.name: Ulrich at MicroEnsure
lenders.loan_because: small loans can make a big difference
lenders.occupational_info: I work for MicroEnsure. We insure poor people against the big risks: health, life and crop/livelihood risks. We do weather insurance for farmers as well.

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: We are all stuck on this planet together so we might as well work with each other to make it a better place.
lenders.occupational_info: I own a internet website that sells health and nutritional products.

lenders.name: Terese
lenders.loan_because: It makes sense to share the wealth.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a wife and mother and artist.  I paint and work with clay.  I am blessed with 2 healthy children and happily married.

lenders.name: Rosemary
lenders.loan_because: we're all in this together - a helping hand to one helps all.
lenders.occupational_info: believer in and activist for humanity and environmental causes.

lenders.name: Julie
lenders.loan_because: I believe in supporting entrepreneurship and independence.  Making loans through Kiva makes me feel good! Thank you for the opportunity to participate!
lenders.occupational_info: I train people to train their dogs so they are good pets and good canine citizens.

lenders.name: SEEDS
lenders.loan_because: we believe in economic justice!

lenders.name: vanessa
lenders.loan_because: There's something to be said of the immense pleasure you get knowing that you are helping peeps who are fiercely working to make even bigger dreams happen.
lenders.occupational_info: Graphic, web designer, future small biz owner.

lenders.name: Mohammad Farid
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people learn how to fish rather than giving them a fish

lenders.name: Shep
lenders.occupational_info: Computer system consulting

lenders.name: balletxaraguahaiti
lenders.occupation: non profit dance school in Haiti

lenders.name: steven
lenders.loan_because: I wish to reach out every day to fight poverty.
lenders.occupational_info: family, community, friends.  Just like everyone else.

lenders.name: Constance
lenders.loan_because: The abundance of wealth in the United States needs to be shared throughout the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I volunteer at the Kalamazoo Ministry drop in center.  I'm active participant in community issues.  I do not support the war in Iraq.

lenders.name: Westtown Friends School
lenders.loan_because: We are studying interest and finances.  We're applying our learning to real world issues by raising money and managing our kiva portfolio.
lenders.occupational_info: Showing that math can be used for social change!

lenders.name: Rita
lenders.loan_because: I believe in empowering people to realize their dreams.

lenders.name: Jim Wilshire
lenders.loan_because: I like to think that I can help make a difference in someone's life.  I think it's a responsibility that certain of us should all share because it's an investment in the future.
lenders.occupational_info: I am an artist.  I love boats and the water and enjoy painting them.

lenders.name: West Third
lenders.loan_because: I've got it way too good not to share what I can sometimes.
lenders.occupational_info: I build and maintain web sites for my own company and for others.

lenders.name: Mark
lenders.loan_because: I admire the hard working people who try to better their lives and the lives of their families and just want to try and help in some small way.

lenders.name: Randy
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people I have needed help from people before. So I would like to help others

lenders.name: Katiana
lenders.loan_because: I understand how rewarding it is to have control over your own finances and the excitement when your business is doing well.
lenders.occupational_info: I silkscreen on t-shirts and other materials.

lenders.name: Amanda Catherine
lenders.loan_because: I'm so greatful that this website exists. This is a great way to offer help to someone who needs a basis to create a successful business.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a student at the University of Connecticut and a waitress at a local restaurant.

lenders.name: Dorrit E. Nelson
lenders.loan_because: I feel compelled to help and I cannot think of a better way to assist others around the world.

lenders.name: Andrea
lenders.loan_because: Although entrepreneurship is not the right path out of poverty for everyone, it is clearly the best path for many.  This is a way for me to help a few people take that first step out of poverty but at a lower "cost" than with outright donations because most of the money will eventually come back to me.  Then I can turn it around and lend it to someone else, and help multiple people with the exact same $25 over and over.  I think that's just very cool!
lenders.occupational_info: I am program manager for the Global Disability Rights Library (GDRL) project.  The GDRL project is working to bring knowledge on disability rights to people in developing countries who have little or no internet access.

lenders.name: Karl
lenders.occupational_info: I grow businesses in a variety of industries.  Currently working with a publisher of games for cell phones.

lenders.name: ken
lenders.loan_because: that is the best way to empower people to take care of themselves

lenders.name: Jil
lenders.loan_because: I believe in teaching a man (or woman) to fish.  And I also think this is the smartest, most creative, most sensible idea in years.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a publishing company, writing advertising, brochures, mini-magazines, marketing materials, and lots of other marketing and promotional items.

lenders.name: Carrie
lenders.loan_because: I like the idea of having a real impact on a real life, of being a part of making someone else's life a little bit better. It's personal. It's effective. And it empowers people to empower themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: My job is very creative. I get to come up with ideas for new toys and new ways to play with them.

lenders.name: Amy
lenders.loan_because: I am also an entrepreneur and am very grateful for my resources and want to share them with other business owners.
lenders.occupational_info: I sell restored vintage metal furniture.

lenders.name: Anna
lenders.loan_because: It's a less patronizing way to help someone.
lenders.occupational_info: I help different people find the books and/or information they need and give them a smile as well.

lenders.name: christoph
lenders.loan_because:
because i care. 
& because i can.

lenders.name: Bob and Abbey
lenders.loan_because: It's such a great idea AND the right thing to do.
lenders.occupational_info: I am retired but volunteer to teach BASE parachuting (fixed object skydiving)and live in Inverness, California, forty miles Northwest of San Francisco.  Abbey lives near London.l

lenders.name: Kim & Terence
lenders.loan_because: It is a direct way to be involved with people.
lenders.occupational_info: We garden with respect for the soil food web, the many invisible critters who live in and make our soils, connecting us all.

lenders.name: Barrie
lenders.loan_because: it's a brilliant way to generate a large impact with a small amount of money.

lenders.name: Van
lenders.loan_because: I want to help the people of Latin America. While studying Spanish, I have lived with several families in Costa Rica, Guatemala, Mexico, and Peru.  I would like to see the economy of their country's improve.
lenders.occupational_info: I am retired, but have worked in adult education most of my life.  I have taught English to students (mostly soldiers) from over 35 countries.

lenders.name: Natalie
lenders.loan_because: I've got extra babysugar!

lenders.name: Anthony
lenders.loan_because: I believe everyone has a duty to help a fellow human being. I feel that I'm just doing my part to help and i really enjoy it.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a Quality Assurance/test engineer, working for a major telecom Co. in Tampa, FL. My work includes testing Applications, processes and IT equipments

lenders.name: Persian
lenders.loan_because: I enjoyed Muhammad Yunus' Nobel Peace Prize speech and wanted to support him and his ideas.

lenders.name: Caroline
lenders.loan_because: it's exciting to see that you can reach out and help someone.  Whenever I see someone struggling on the margins, I think "there but for the grace of God."  I've had success in life, but wonder if I would have been able to succeed without all the benefits of growing up middle-class in America.
lenders.occupational_info: I develop books.

lenders.name: Team Grotto
lenders.loan_because: We are all distribution centers for our prosperity.  We are grateful for the opportunity to believe in people/businesses.  Thank you.
lenders.occupational_info: Our team does marketing/business development.

lenders.name: Lawrence
lenders.loan_because: I like to make the world sing in perfect harmony.
lenders.occupational_info: I over see a group of people with disablitys, and help them produce the best printer cartridge that is then sold.

lenders.name: August
lenders.loan_because: I have some money saved but I do not like to give to charities. This is a much better way to be productive with saved money.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a retired university professor.
